result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph E Besler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph E Besler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph E Besler was found guilty of Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Joseph E Besler was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: TO DA's office for the victim, Rita O.
Per DA's office, New Berlin claims they don't have the $200.00. $100.00 held in trust on each co-defendant will be sent to DA's office for R. Olson (restitution)
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joseph E Besler in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has completed his deferred prosecution agreement and court vacates previous findings.   Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 and 5 of the Amended Information.  Count 3 is dismissed outright.  Counts 7, 9 and 11 are dismissed and read-in.  Court imposes the following sentence:

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE:  AS TO EACH COUNT

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS AS TO EACH COUNT 
If revoked, 12 days credit

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

Probation can be transferred to Milwaukee County


RESTITUTION:  $750 to Kevin Brandt and $200 to Rita Olson, jointly and severally;  $100 from bail to remain in trust.  State to turn over $200 previously posted in New Berlin to Ms. Olson. If they don't have the $200.00, the $100 left in trust to go to Ms. Olson for restitution. Bail to be applied to the $750 restitution and the costs and surcharges and refund the balance to the poster. 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 as to each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DRGOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00 as to count 1

Defendant may petition for early termination after 12 months of probation (upon all fees and compliance being made with probation).
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph E Besler in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Redetzke states they are prepared to enter a plea but the defendant has been offered the Drug Treatment Court.  Atty. Redetzke states he was advised to request a date in May by ADA Will.  

Court suggests enter a plea and then withholding judgment or entry into the DTC.  Atty. Redetzke is agreeable.  

Court reviews WCS non-compliance letter.  Statements by Atty. Redetzke regarding the non-compliance.  Court will proceed with a plea today and follow the DTC procedure.  Court will then address the non-compliance letter.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 3 and 7. Counts 1, 5, 9 and 11 are dismissed and read in.  Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment and puts the case over for 30 days to see the status of DTC.

Court maintains bail but will increase bail to $10,000.00 upon the next non-compliance letter from WCS.  Review hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
